name: Akt
comment: Found in the C-terminal hydrophobic motif. Phosphorylation at this site by mTORC2 stimulates Akt activity (PMID 15718470).

name: mTOR
comment: Originally considered an Akt target (Sekulić et al., 2000; Navé et al., 1999), more recent evidence suggests that S2448 is actually phosphorylated by p70-S6K (Chiang & Abraham, 2005; Holz & Blenis, 2005). This presents a feedback loop, although its function has not been elucidated. Since S2448 lies within the repressor domain, it has been speculated that phosphorylation at this site represses mTOR activity (Sekulić et al., 2000), but does not affect mTORC1 complex formation (Rosner et al., 2010).

name: Grb10
comment: Enhances stability of Grb10. Evidence suggests that this then reduces signalling either through insulin receptor or by influencing mTORC1 instead (PMID 21659604, 21659605, 24746805). Nevertheless, this phosphorylation site leads to feedback regulation of insulin signalling.
